item.text: Then the heads of the family groups of the Gileadites, the descendant of Machir, the descendant of Manasseh, who were from the Josephite families, approached and spoke before Moses and the leaders who were the heads of the Israelite families.

They said, “The Lord commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance by lot to the Israelites; and my lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.

Now if they should <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">married</st> to <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="01121" class="">men</st><n id="1" /> from another <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelite</st> <st data-num="07626" class="">tribe</st>, their <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> would be <st data-num="01639" class="">taken</st> from the <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> of our <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st> and <st data-num="03254" class="">added</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> into <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> they <st data-num="01961" class="">marry</st>.<n id="2" /> As a result, it will be <st data-num="01639" class="">taken</st> from the <st data-num="01486" class="">lot</st> of our <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st>.

And when the Jubilee of the Israelites is to take place, their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they marry. So their inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our ancestral tribe.”
Then Moses gave a ruling to the Israelites by the word of the Lord: “What the tribe of the Josephites is saying is right.
This is what the Lord has commanded for Zelophehad’s daughters: ‘Let them marry whomever they think best, only they must marry within the family of their father’s tribe.

In this way the <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> will <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="05437" class="">transferred</st><n id="1" /> from <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">But</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">every one</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> must <st data-num="01692" class="">retain</st> the <st data-num="04294 01">ancestral</st> <st data-num="05159" class="">heritage</st>.

And <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st> who <st data-num="03423" class="">possesses</st> an <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> from any of the <st data-num="04294" class="">tribes</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> must <st data-num="01961" class="">become</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> of a <st data-num="0259" class="">man</st> from any <st data-num="04940" class="">family</st> in her <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="04294" class="">tribe</st>, <st data-num="04616" class="">so that</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">every</st> <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelite</st><n id="1" /> may <st data-num="03423" class="">retain</st> the <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> of his <st data-num="01" class="">fathers</st>.
No inheritance may pass from tribe to tribe. But every one of the tribes of the Israelites must retain its inheritance.’”
As the Lord had commanded Moses, so the daughters of Zelophehad did.

For the <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> of <st data-num="06765" class="">Zelophehad</st>—<st data-num="04244" class="">Mahlah</st>, <st data-num="08656" class="">Tirzah</st>, <st data-num="02295" class="">Hoglah</st>, <st data-num="04435" class="">Milcah</st>, and <st data-num="05270" class="">Noah</st>—<st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">married</st> to the <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> of their <st data-num="01730" class="">uncles</st>.<n id="1" />
They were married into the families of the Manassehites, the descendants of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in the tribe of their father’s family.
These are the commandments and the decisions that the Lord commanded the Israelites through the authority of Moses, in the rift valley plains by Moab along the Jordan River opposite Jericho.
